summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9, 2019. The sheets are used to document staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of institutional record-keeping in place at the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

events.title: Daily inmate observation checks
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted and documented throughout the day.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison check sheet from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 9, 2019.
It details the protocol for observing inmates in locked-down status (e.g., administrative detention) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are reviewed and signed by lieutenants and a captain for different watch periods (Morning, Day, Evening).
No specific inmate names are listed, only the observation log structure and staff signatures.
This type of document is relevant to understanding the monitoring procedures in place at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
